intro: Psychotria glandulicalyx, commonly known as the glandular-leaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves with prominent glandular dots on their surface. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
